subject: History
title: The Ninja: Shadows of Japan
description: One-minute skill: The Ninja: Shadows of Japan.

hook.text: Ninjas weren't black-clad assassins leaping across rooftops. They were spies who hid in plain sight.

buildup.text: Shinobi emerged in feudal Japan as covert agents hired by warlords for espionage, sabotage, and reconnaissance.

discovery.text: They disguised themselves as monks, merchants, and farmers. Their greatest skill was being invisible in a crowd.

twist.text: The famous black costume is a mythâ€”it comes from Kabuki theater, where stagehands wore black to seem invisible.

climax.text: Real ninja clans like the Iga and Koga were eventually destroyed by Oda Nobunaga, who united Japan by force.

punchline.text: History's best spies were ordinary people, not warriors.

quiz.question: Where does the iconic black ninja costume actually come from?
options: Kabuki theater, where stagehands wore black
